page.title: 02ANCIENT BUILDINGS
page.content: There are no ancient buildings in the block except the three churches of Fishtoft, Freiston and Butterwick. Fishtoft Church is called St. Guthlac's and is linked to Crowland Abbey. It has a white flagpole on top of the tower which is paid for by the docks at Boston because it is marked on sailor's charts. It has a very good set of bells. The elms around the church have just been cut down because of Dutch Elms Disease. Freiston St. James is another very fine church with some Norman work, but is mainly much later. It has a lot of brickwork in it and is not set on a mound like Fishtoft. Butterwick St. Andrew is the least interesting church because very little of it is original, many repairs and renovations having taken place in the last 200 years.
